trans-unit.source: Provides event data for the <xref href="System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.ValidatingPassword"></xref> event of the <xref href="System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider"></xref> class.

The <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.ValidatingPassword> event is raised when the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.CreateUser%2A>, <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.ChangePassword%2A>, or <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.ResetPassword%2A> method of a membership provider is called.
You can handle the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.ValidatingPassword> event to validate password formats and values for membership users.

You can cancel the current <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.CreateUser%2A>, <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.ChangePassword%2A>, or <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.ResetPassword%2A> action by setting the <xref:System.Web.Security.ValidatePasswordEventArgs.Cancel%2A> property to `true` during the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.ValidatingPassword> event.

If you cancel the current action by setting the <xref:System.Web.Security.ValidatePasswordEventArgs.Cancel%2A> property to `true`, you can set the <xref:System.Web.Security.ValidatePasswordEventArgs.FailureInformation%2A> property to an exception that describes the reason for the password-validation failure.
The calling method will throw the exception that the <xref:System.Web.Security.ValidatePasswordEventArgs.FailureInformation%2A> property is set to.
If the <xref:System.Web.Security.ValidatePasswordEventArgs.FailureInformation%2A> property is `null`, the caller will throw a generic password-validation failure exception.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Security.ValidatePasswordEventArgs"></xref> class.

The <xref:System.Web.Security.ValidatePasswordEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor is used by a membership provider implementation in the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.CreateUser%2A>, <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.ChangePassword%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.ResetPassword%2A> method implementations.
The membership user name for the current create-user, change-password, or reset-password action.
The new password for the specified membership user.
`true` if the event is occurring while a new user is being created; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the current create-user, change-password, or reset-password action will be canceled.

The <xref:System.Web.Security.ValidatePasswordEventArgs.Cancel%2A> property is used to cancel the current <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.CreateUser%2A>, <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.ChangePassword%2A>, or <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.ResetPassword%2A> action.

You can cancel the current action by setting the <xref:System.Web.Security.ValidatePasswordEventArgs.Cancel%2A> property to `true` during the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.ValidatingPassword> event.

If you cancel the current action by setting the <xref:System.Web.Security.ValidatePasswordEventArgs.Cancel%2A> property to `true`, you can set the <xref:System.Web.Security.ValidatePasswordEventArgs.FailureInformation%2A> property to an exception that describes the reason for the password-validation failure.
The calling method will throw the exception that the <xref:System.Web.Security.ValidatePasswordEventArgs.FailureInformation%2A> property is set to.
If the <xref:System.Web.Security.ValidatePasswordEventArgs.FailureInformation%2A> property is `null`, the caller will throw a generic password-validation failure exception.
`true` if the current create-user, change-password, or reset-password action will be canceled; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets an exception that describes the reason for the password-validation failure.

The <xref:System.Web.Security.ValidatePasswordEventArgs.FailureInformation%2A> property is used when the current <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.CreateUser%2A>, <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.ChangePassword%2A>, or <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.ResetPassword%2A> action has been canceled by setting the <xref:System.Web.Security.ValidatePasswordEventArgs.Cancel%2A> property to `true`.
The <xref:System.Web.Security.ValidatePasswordEventArgs.FailureInformation%2A> property is set to an exception that describes the reason for the password-validation failure.
The calling method will throw the exception that the <xref:System.Web.Security.ValidatePasswordEventArgs.FailureInformation%2A> property is set to.
If the <xref:System.Web.Security.ValidatePasswordEventArgs.FailureInformation%2A> property is `null`, the caller will throw a generic password-validation failure exception.
An <xref href="System.Exception"></xref> that describes the reason for the password-validation failure.

Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.ValidatingPassword"></xref> event is being raised during a call to the <xref href="System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.CreateUser(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Object,System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateStatus@)"></xref> method.

`true` if the <xref href="System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.ValidatingPassword"></xref> event is being raised during a call to the <xref href="System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.CreateUser(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Object,System.Web.Security.MembershipCreateStatus@)"></xref> method; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the password for the current create-user, change-password, or reset-password action.

The <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.ValidatingPassword> event is raised when the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.CreateUser%2A>, <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.ChangePassword%2A>, or <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.ResetPassword%2A> method of a membership provider is called.
You can handle the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.ValidatingPassword> event to validate password formats and values for membership users.

You can cancel the current <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.CreateUser%2A>, <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.ChangePassword%2A>, or <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.ResetPassword%2A> action by setting the <xref:System.Web.Security.ValidatePasswordEventArgs.Cancel%2A> property to `true` during the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipProvider.ValidatingPassword> event.

If you cancel the current action by setting the <xref:System.Web.Security.ValidatePasswordEventArgs.Cancel%2A> property to `true`, you can set the <xref:System.Web.Security.ValidatePasswordEventArgs.FailureInformation%2A> property to an exception that describes the reason for the password-validation failure.
The calling method will throw the exception that the <xref:System.Web.Security.ValidatePasswordEventArgs.FailureInformation%2A> property is set to.
If the <xref:System.Web.Security.ValidatePasswordEventArgs.FailureInformation%2A> property is `null`, the caller will throw a generic password-validation failure exception.
The password for the current create-user, change-password, or reset-password action.
Gets the name of the membership user for the current create-user, change-password, or reset-password action.
The name of the membership user for the current create-user, change-password, or reset-password action.
